description.climate: No climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards; constant 1850 levels of CO₂ before 1850 and based on observations afterwards
description.soc: Fixed 1850 levels of direct human forcing before 1850, varying direct human influences according to observations afterwards

description.climate: No climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards; constant 1850 levels of CO₂ before 1850 and based on observations afterwards
description.soc: Fixed 2015 levels of direct human forcing for the entire time period

description.climate: No climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards; 1850 levels of CO₂ before 1850 and based on observations afterwards

experiments.title: counterfactual climate
experiments.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: de-trended observational climate forcing (counterfactual "no climate change" situation) + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: 1850 levels of direct human forcing before 1850, varying direct human influences according to observations afterwards

experiments.spin_up: "histsoc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

experiments.title: counterfactual climate
experiments.subtitle: 2015soc

description.climate: de-trended observational climate forcing (counterfactual "no climate change" situation) + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: fixed 2015 levels of direct human influences for the entire time period

experiments.spin_up: "2015soc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

experiments.title: counterfactual climate
experiments.subtitle: nat

description.climate: de-trended observational climate forcing (counterfactual "no climate change" situation) + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level

experiments.spin_up: "nat" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

experiments.title: Water management sensitivity
experiments.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: no climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: no accounting for water management but representation of other direct human influences such as land use changes according to "histsoc"

experiments.spin_up: "histsoc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

experiments.title: Water management sensitivity
experiments.subtitle: 2015soc

description.climate: no climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: no accounting for water management but representation of other direct human influences such as land use patterns according to "2015soc"

forest_stand.title: Hyytiälä
forest_stand.comment: Note that an experimental plot of pine contains a lot of data while footprint of flux tower is larger. Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

forest_stand.title: Peitz
forest_stand.comment: Managed using a weak thinning from below.

forest_stand.title: Kranzberg Roof Project
forest_stand.comment: Unmanaged/ thinning from below in past 20 years for all species.

soc_scenario.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period (1850-2014) (e.g. observed changes in historical land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-2015 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.
Please only label your model run `nat` if it does not at all account for any direct human forcings, including e.g. human land use.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.
Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Water that percolates through the soil layer(s) into the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.
Water that leaves the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.long_name: Soil Moisture Content at Root Zone

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Total simulated soil moisture available for evapotranspiration. Please indicate the depth of the root zone for each vegetation type in your model. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m.

Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". This is the most important variable for the permafrost sector. If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Grid cell mean depth of snowpack. This variable only for the purposes of the permafrost sector.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell. Please also deliver for the permafrost sector.
Mean monthly water storage in all compartments. Please indicate in the netcdf metadata which storage compartments are considered.
Mean monthly water storage in the canopy.
Mean monthly water storage in glaciers.
Mean monthly water storage in groundwater layer.
Mean monthly water storage in lakes (except reservoirs).
Mean monthly water storage in wetlands.
Mean monthly water storage in rivers.
Mean monthly water storage in reservoirs.
Calculated from daily thaw depths.
Mean monthly water temperature in river (representative of the average temperature across the channel volume).

variable.long_name: Potential Irrigation Water Withdrawal (assuming unlimited water supply)

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Irrigation water withdrawn in case of optimal irrigation (in addition to rainfall).

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Irrigation water withdrawal, taking water availability into account; please provide if computed.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, assuming unlimited water supply.
Soil water demand required to avoid water stress, excluding any water losses associate with application or transport.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, taking water availability into account; if computed.

variable.long_name: Actual Irrigation Green Water Consumption on Irrigated Cropland

variable.comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Potential evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed and different from AIrrUseGreen.

variable.comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over rainfed cropland; if computed.

Sum of actual consumptive water use from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.
Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) water withdrawal from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.
Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) consumptive water use from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.
If computed. There is no need to submit ainduse if its components are being submitted separately (ainduse = amanuse + aelecuse).
If computed. There is no need to submit aindww if its components are being submitted separately (aindww = amanww + aelecww).
If computed. There is no need to submit pinduse if its components are being submitted separately (pinduse = pmanuse + pelecuse).
If computed. There is no need to submit pindww if its components are being submitted separately (pindww = pmanww + pelecww).

Soil types or texture classes as used by your model. Please include a description of each type or class, especially if these are different from the standard HSWD and GSWP3 soil types. Please also include a description of the parameters and values associated with these soil types (parameter values could be submitted as spatial fields where appropriate).

variable.units: dry matter (t ha-1 per growing season)
variable.comment: Crop-specific: Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production.
Portion of all water (including rain) that is evapo-transpired, the water amount should be accumulated over the entire growing period (not the calendar year)
Total nitrogen application rate. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, rate should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).
Julian dates.
This allows for clear identification of planting that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project
Together with the year of anthesis added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.
It allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.
Together with the year of maturity added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.
It allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

Ideally should be modeled with realistic land-use history and initial carbon pools. Subject to extra study.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Species information is essential. Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

comment.biomes: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. Species information is essential.
comment.fire: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.fire: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation.  If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.

variable.long_name: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change

comment.biomes: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
comment.fire: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
comment.forestry: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
variable.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

variable.long_name: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change
variable.comment: For wood products only. Sum of CO₂ fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emsissions from previous years.

variable.long_name: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Grazing
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
variable.comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation
variable.comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.
The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
Includes sublimation.
Including sapwood and hardwood.
Including fine and coarse roots.

variable.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface
variable.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
variable.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. the residual term of the surface energy balance, i.e. the net amount of energy that enters the lake on daily time scale: lakeheatf = swdown - swup + lwdown - lwup - sensheatf - latenheatf (terms defined positive when directed upwards)

variable.comment: Catch at sea (commercial landings plus discards, fish and invertebrates)

variable.long_name: Total Catch in log10 Weight Bins
variable.comment: If the model is size-structured, please provide catch in equal log10 g C weight bins (1g, 10g, 100g, 1kg, 10kg, 100kg)
Catch at sea of all pelagic consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)
Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity <30 cm

variable.long_name: Catch Density of Medium Pelagics >=30cm and <90cm
variable.comment: Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity >=30 cm and <90 cm
Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity >=90 cm
Catch at sea of all demersal consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)
Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity <30 cm

variable.long_name: Catch Density of Medium Demersals >=30cm and <90cm
variable.comment: Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=30 cm and <90 cm
Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=90 cm

variable.long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Cold
variable.comment: For ERF models, this occurs when temperature is below threshold (e.g., minimum mortality temperature (MMT)). Report 0 if temperature above threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

variable.long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Heat
variable.comment: Temperature above threshold (ERFs). Report 0 if temperature below threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

To be reported as annual series of mean daily total mortality, or as a single number of mean daily mortality; to be used for computations of attributable fractions. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
Baseline population data should be provided for computations of mortality rates (i.e. deaths per total population). See Section ‎5.1.6. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

variable.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change
variable.comment: Deforestation fires
Should not be part of ffire

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change
variable.comment: C emitted from deforestation fires (if simulated).
If calculated, weighted by burned area. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
as appropriate for your model

variable.long_name: Combustion Completeness of Different Fuel Classes
variable.comment: (between 0 and 1), fraction of fuel combusted in a fire

variable.long_name: Fuel Moisture for Different Fuel Classes
variable.comment: as a fraction of fuel dry mass (not percentage)
95th percentile of number of fires in one day during the month
fraction of area covered by trees
Monthly mean weighted with the number of fires of each day
95th percentile of fire size computed during the month
Mean needs to be weighted with the number of fires

variable.long_name: Weighted Mean Fire Rate of Spread
variable.comment: Mean needs to be weighted with burned area
mean height of canopy formed by trees over 5m.  Vegetation of less than 5m should be excluded from the canopy height calculation (i.e. not contributing with zero)
fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation less than 5 m tall
fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation more than 5 m tall
The total area associated with each grid cell in the model.

The fraction of each grid cell that is assumed to be continent, i.e., not ocean. Should be 0 if the entire cell is assumed to be ocean, 1 if the entire cell is assumed to be covered by land or inland water bodies.

sens_scenario.description: For all experiments other than the sensitivity experiments.
CO₂ concentration fixed at 1901 levels as a deviation from the “obsclim” climate + CO₂ forcing.
No water management (e.g. no human water abstraction) while other direct human forcings such as land use changes are considered according to histsoc or 2015soc.

soc_dataset.title: Landuse totals
variables: share of managed pastures or rangeland (pastures)
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al, in review, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Downscaling to 5 crops
variables: share of rainfed/irrigated C4 annual crops (c4ann_rainfed, c4ann_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 perennial crops (c3per_rainfed, c3per_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 N-fixing crops (c3nfx_rainfed, c3nfx_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C4 annual crops (c4ann_rainfed, c4ann_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C4 perennial crops (c4per_rainfed, c4per_irrigated)
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al., in review, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Downscaling to 15 crops
variables: share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (groundnut) (oil_crops_groundnut_rainfed, oil_crops_groundnut_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (rapeseed) (oil_crops_rapeseed_rainfed, oil_crops_rapeseed_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (soybean) (oil_crops_soybean_rainfed, oil_crops_soybean_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (sunflower) (oil_crops_sunflower_rainfed, oil_crops_sunflower_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated temperate cereals (temperate_cereals_rainfed, temperate_cereals_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated temperate roots (temperate_roots_rainfed, temperate_roots_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated tropical cereals (tropical_cereals_rainfed, tropical_cereals_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated tropical roots (tropical_roots_rainfed, tropical_roots_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 annual crops not covered by the above (others_c3ann_rainfed, others_c3ann_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 N-fixing crops not covered by the above (others_c3nfx_rainfed, others_c3nfx_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 perennial crops (c3per_rainfed, c3per_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C4 perennial crops (c4per_rainfed, c4per_irrigated)
share of pastures, both managed and rangeland (pastures)
soc_dataset.comment: The C4 perennial crops are not further downscaled from the "5 crops" data set and currently only include sugarcane.  Similarly, the C3 perennial crops are not downscaled either. The data is derived from the "5 crops" LUH2 data, and the crops have been downscaled to 15 crops according to the ratios given by the Monfreda data set (Monfreda, Ramankutty, & Foley, 2008).

soc_dataset.title: Managed pastures and rangeland
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al, in review., see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Urban areas
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al., in review, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Nitrogen deposited by fertilizers on croplands
variables: deposition of N through fertilizer on cropland with C3 annual crops (fertl_c3ann)
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the LUH2 v2h data set (see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al., in in review, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Reduced nitrogen deposition
soc_dataset.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. Data in 2015 and 2016 is assumed to be same as that in 2014 (Tian et al. 2018)

soc_dataset.title: Oxidized nitrogen deposition
soc_dataset.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014.  Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. Data in 2015 and 2016 is assumed to be same as that in 2014 (Tian et al. 2018)

soc_dataset.title: Reservoirs & dams
variables: Unique ID representing a dam and its associated reservoir corresponding to GRanD/KSU IDs (ID)
location adjusted to the DDM30 routing network (LON_DDM30, LAT_DDM30)
flag to indicate that the year of dam construction has been artificially set to 1850 if not existing (FLAG_ART=1, otherwise 0)
alternative year may indicate a multi-year construction or secondary dam (ALT_YEAR)
flag of correction if relocation was applied (FLAG_CORR)
river name which the dam impounds (RIVER)
soc_dataset.comment: Lehner et al. (2011a, <https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK>), Lehner et al. (2011b, <https://dx.doi.org/10.1890/100125>), and Jida Wang et al. (KSU/Kansas State University, personal communication). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications. Please contact <info@isimip.org> in case of questions.

soc_dataset.title: Water abstraction for domestic and industrial purposes
variables: domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption (domww, domwc, indww, indwc)
soc_dataset.comment: For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08. This data is based ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project (Wada et al., 2016, <http://www.geosci-model-dev.net/9/175/2016/>) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

soc_dataset.title: Fishing effort
soc_dataset.resolution: Marine ecosystems or exclusive economic zones
soc_dataset.comment: Data comprise the nominal effort of industrial and artisanal fleets aggregated into 6 functional groups. Source: Rousseau et al., 2019, PNAS 116 (25) 12238-12243.

soc_dataset.title: Fish catch
soc_dataset.resolution: Marine ecosystems or exclusive economic zones
soc_dataset.comment: Data comprise the nominal effort of industrial and artisanal fleets aggregated into 6 functional groups. Reference for data source: Watson and Tidd, 2018, Marine Policy, 93: 171-177.

soc_dataset.title: Forest management
soc_dataset.comment: Reyer et al. 2019, 2020 management prescribes stem numbers remaining after harvest, management data is annual but not every year has data.

soc_dataset.title: Wood harvesting
variables: wood harvest area from primary forest land (primf-harv)
wood harvest area from primary non forest land (primn-harv)
wood harvest area from secondary mature forest land (secmf-harv)
wood harvest area from secondary young forest land (secyf-harv)
wood harvest area from secondary non forest land (secnf-harv)
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary forest land (primf-bioh)
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary non forest land (primn-bioh)
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary mature forest land (secmf-bioh)
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary young forest land (secyf-bioh)
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary non forest land (secnf-bioh)
soc_dataset.comment: Historic annual country-level wood harvesting data. Based on the LUH2 v2h Harmonization Data Set (see Hurtt, Chini et al. 2011; see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). Interpolated to a 0.5° grid using first-order conservative remapping and calculated over a fractional country mask (<https://gitlab.pik-potsdam.de/isipedia/countrymasks/-/blob/master/>) derived from ASAP-GAUL (<https://data.europa.eu/euodp/data/dataset/jrc-10112-10004>).

variables: percentage of lakes in grid cell (pct_lake)
soc_dataset.comment: HydroLAKES polygons dataset v1.0 June 2019 and GRanD v1.3, rasterized using the polygon_to_cellareafraction tool (https://github.com/VUB-HYDR/polygon_to_cellareafraction). Reference: Messager et al. (2016, <https://dx.doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603>, Lehner et al. (2011b, <https://dx.doi.org/10.1890/100125>).

soc_dataset.title: Population 5' grid
soc_dataset.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 2000 have been linearly interpolated in time.

soc_dataset.title: Population 0.5° grid
soc_dataset.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 2000 have been linearly interpolated in time. Aggregated to 0.5° spatial resolution

soc_dataset.title: Population national
variables: total number of people per country
soc_dataset.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (based on WPP 2017 revision, following the methodology of Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 1950 have been linearly interpolated in time.

soc_dataset.title: Population density 5' grid
variables: total number of people per square kilometer (popc)
rural number of people per square kilometer (rurc)
urban number of people per square kilometer (urbc)
soc_dataset.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 2000 have been linearly interpolated in time.

soc_dataset.title: Population density 0.5° grid
variables: total number of people per square kilometer (popc)
rural number of people per square kilometer (rurc)
urban number of people per square kilometer (urbc)
soc_dataset.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 2000 have been linearly interpolated in time. Aggregated to 0.5° spatial resolution

soc_dataset.title: Population density national
variables: total number of people per square kilometer
soc_dataset.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (based on WPP 2017 revision, following the methodology of Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 1950 have been linearly interpolated in time.

soc_dataset.title: GDP
soc_dataset.comment: Historic country-level GDP data are an extension of the data provided by Geiger, 2018 (<https://www.earth-syst-sci-data.net/10/847/2018/essd-10-847-2018.html>), and are derived mainly from the Maddison Project database. Gridded GDP data will be provided by c. 07/2021.

product.title: Input Data
product.description: The data used to drive the impact models, exactly as described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Input Data
product.description: Data that have been derived from or are related to the input data, but not described in the simulation protocol (e.g. with a differnt spatial or temporal resolution).

product.title: Output Data
product.description: The climate-impacts simulation data provided by participating modelling groups, corresponding to the output variables described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Output Data
product.description: Data that have been derived by processing the ISIMIP output data, but do not correspond to output variables described in the simulation protocol.

bias_adjustment.description: Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).
Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.

geo_dataset.comment: This is the land-sea mask of the W5E5 dataset (Lange, 2019a; Cucchi et al., 2020). Over all grid cells marked as land by this mask, all climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land.

This is the generic land-sea mask from ISIMIP2b that is to be used for global water simulations in ISIMIP3. It marks more grid cells as land than **landseamask**. Over those additional land cells, the climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are not guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. Instead they may represent climate conditions over sea or a mix of conditions over land and sea.

One fixed pattern to be used for all simulation periods. Upscaled Soil texture map (30 arc sec. to 0.5°x0.5° grid) based on Harmonized World Soil Database v1.1 (HWSD) using the GSWP3 upscaling method A (<http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~sujan/research/gswp3/soil-texture-map.html>)

variables: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)
geo_dataset.comment: These data are based on the soil data from HWSD. The data originally sit on a 0°0'30" grid and were aggregated to the ISIMIP 0.5° grid. Only the top soil layer properties are given, however on request deeper soil layers could be provided. The aggregation has been performed with the agriculture sector in mind (the aggregation uses the MIRCA data set, see Portmann, F. T., Siebert, S., & Döll, P., 2010, <http://doi.org/10.1029/2008GB003435>). For further details please refer to the README in the `ISIMIP3a/InputData/geo_conditions/soil/` folder.

geo_dataset.title: basins
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

geo_dataset.title: flowdir
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

geo_dataset.title: slopes
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

variables: total lake surface area in grid cell (tot_area)
average surface area of lakes in grid cell (avg_area)

geo_dataset.comment: For these variables, new forcing files will be provided soon: histsoc, accounting for reservoir expansion; and 2015soc.

climate_forcing.title: GSWP3-W5E5
climate_forcing.comments: Combination of W5E5 (Lange, 2019a; Cucchi et al., 2020) for 1979-2016 with GSWP3 (Dirmeyer et al., 2006) homogenized to W5E5 for 1901-1978. The homogenization reduces discontinuities at the 1978/1979 transition and was done using the ISIMIP3BASD v2.4.1 bias adjustment method (Lange, 2019b; Lange, 2020).

climate_forcing.title: GSWP3
climate_forcing.comments: Dynamically downscaled and bias-adjusted 20th Century Reanalysis (20CR; Compo et al., 2011) from the Global Soil Wetness Project Phase 3 (GSWP3; Dirmeyer et al., 2006).

dimensions.long_name: Depth of vertical layer center below land

climate_scenario.description: Observed climate and CO₂ forcing used for model evaluation and the detection and attribution task.
Detrended version of the observed climate forcing used to spin-up the simulations based on a stable 1900 climate (see explanation below for details regarding the design of the spin-up)
Detrended version of the observed climate forcing used for the "no climate change" baseline simulations in the context of the detection and attributions task.

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3a simulation round
simulation_round.description: Historical model evaluation and attribution runs

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3b simulation round
simulation_round.description: GCM-based simulations assuming fixed 2015 direct human influences for the future

comment.ISIMIP3a: Meinshausen et al. (2011) for 1850-2005 and Dlugokencky & Tans (2019) from 2006-2018.
comment.ISIMIP3b: Meinshausen, Raper, & Wigley (2011) for 1850-2005 and 2016-2100 and Dlugokencky & Tans (2019) from 2006-2015

harmonization.title: Default
harmonization.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

harmonization.title: Fully harmonized
harmonization.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmonization.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmonization.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated. Please contact the sector coordination to push on with this side branch.
